text: Al-Daylami or al-Dailami () is a nisba indicating a Dailamite or a person from Daylam. It may refer to: *Fayruz al-Daylami, companion of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. *Muta of Daylam, king of Daylam *John of Dailam, 7th-century East Syriac Christian saint and monk *Al-Farra', 8/9th-century Kufan scholar *Imad al-Dawla Daylami, founder of the Buyid dynasty (r. 934–949) *'Adud al-Dawla Daylami, emir of the Buyid dynasty (r. 949-983) *Abu'l-Fath an-Nasir ad- Dailami, Zaidi imam in Yemen (r. 1038-1053) *Abu'l-Hasan Mihyar al-Daylami 11th-century Arabic-language poet *Abū Manṣūr al-Daylamī, 12th-century Islamic scholar and author of Musnad al-Firdous *Malek Deylami, 16th century scrivener and calligrapher Category:Nisbas
title: Al-Daylami
